intro: Thyrsacanthus secundus, commonly known as the goldenrod, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and marshes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branching. Thyrsacanthus secundus plays an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies during the fall season.
